title: Snakeyaml vulnerability in quarkus 2.16.12.Final
body:
### Describe the bug

By using quarkus-smallrye-openapi via quarkus-universe-bom version 2.16.9.Final, it pulls snakeyaml version 1.33 which has a reported critical vulnerability: https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2022-1471

I've checked and found the very recent Quarkus release (2.16.12.Final) still pulls the same problematic version. At this point I cannot upgrade to Quarkus 3, unfortunately. While I do understand (my customer does not...) that Quarkus itself is safe to use, would it really be a bid deal upgrading snakeyaml to version 2.2 in Quarkus 2.16.13.Final?

UPDATE: Apart from snakeyaml I would like to report 2 more (and really nothing else) dependencies with vulnerabilities in Quarkus 2.16.12.Final:
io.vertx:vertx-web - version 4.3.7 (new version is 4.3.8)
com.google.guava:guava - version 31.1-jre (new version is 32.1.3-jre)

I truly appreciate your understanding in this matter.

### Expected behavior

_No response_

### Actual behavior

_No response_
